divs: sighting detailsufo sighting 12\8\2007 @ 6:30pm in order to establish a foundation for the ufo sighting, i would like to establish the circumstances for the sighting. my wife and i live in the southeastern section of indianapolis. we have a business in nashville, in, about 45 miles south of indianapolis, in. we take the same route to and back from nashville, using highway 135. we���ve had our business in nashville for over two years now. during the winter hours, some days while driving back to indianapolis, it has already turned dark, depending on when we leave nashville. we have never before, saw or looked for, anything unusual as our minds are never focused on ufos but ordinary business concerns or listening to talk radio. this evening, not unlike many evenings in central indiana during the early winter, it was dark and raining. there was a fair amount of traffic in both directions and it is a two lane highway. as we were driving north toward indianapolis, at about 20 miles south of indianapolis, a few miles south of bargersville, off to our left, about 800 to 1000 feet west of us and about the same distance in the sky, we suddenly noticed a extremely bright, flashing strobe-like light, flashing about once a second in the dark rainy sky. my first thought and comment to marilyn was that it must be one of those microwave towers as i knew that a few miles ahead near bargersville, they had some microwave towers that we���ve observed during the daylight hours. as we were driving northward on h135 about 60 mph, we soon approached the east side of the flashing light which was now directly west of us about 800 to 1000 feet in the sky and probably that far west of us. however, instead of us passing it, it appeared to start pacing us at about the same speed. there were no colored lights, just the one rather large, extremely bright strobe-type light that was bluish-white. it was so extra bright that when it was flashing, it lit up everything on the ground in the direction of the object. i was driving so i could only glance at the flashing object for a split second but marilyn was able to watch it for perhaps 30 seconds or more. as she became more excited and astonished at what she was witnessing, the flashing object suddenly turned off to the left, heading west and disappeared. while we were really puzzled as to what it was, i didn���t consider stopping at the time because of the traffic behind me and no real place to pull over. it was only after this short experience that we were forced to conclude that it may have been a ufo because of the special characteristics of object. we have concluded that it was flying too show to be an airplane and didn���t seem to behave like a helicopter. this will remain a mystery for us.
